title: Bantu (Nkobô Bulu) - John (Book)
description: Bantu translation of the Gospel of John. Bantu is a name given to a group of Niger–Congo languages spoken in central and southern Africa.

language.name: Bulu (Cameroon)
language.area: South Province, entire Ntem and Dja-and-Lobo divisions; south Upper Sanaga Division; Center Province, north Nyong-and-Mfoumou Division; East Province, part of Upper Nyong Division.
